title: Database Management Systems
subtitle: Understand data modeling, SQL, and transaction management

topics.title: Introduction to DBMS
topics.description: Need, applications, types of database management systems, DBMS vs File System, DBMS architecture, and database users and roles.
subtopics: Types of DBMS (Hierarchical, Network, Relational, Object-oriented)

topics.title: Relational Model
topics.description: Concepts of relations, schema, keys, integrity constraints, relational algebra, and relational calculus.
subtopics: Keys: Super Key, Candidate Key, Primary Key, Foreign Key
Relational Algebra (Selection, Projection, Union, Intersection, Difference, Join, Division)

topics.title: Entity-Relationship Model
topics.description: ER diagrams, entities, attributes, relationships, cardinality, weak entities, and enhanced ER model.

topics.title: SQL
topics.description: SQL basics, DDL, DML, DCL, constraints, aggregate functions, joins, subqueries, views, indexes, triggers, and stored procedures.
subtopics: Data Definition Language (DDL): CREATE, ALTER, DROP
Data Manipulation Language (DML): SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE
Constraints in SQL (Primary Key, Foreign Key, Unique, Not Null, Check)
Aggregate Functions (COUNT, SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX)

topics.title: Normalization
topics.description: Introduction to normalization, functional dependencies, 1NF to 5NF, BCNF, and decomposition.

topics.title: Transactions and Concurrency
topics.description: Transaction concepts, ACID properties, transaction states, schedules, concurrency control, deadlock handling, and recovery techniques.

topics.title: Indexing and File Organization
topics.description: File organization methods, indexing basics, primary and secondary indexes, dense and sparse indexes, B-trees, B+ trees, and query optimization.

topics.title: NoSQL and Modern Databases
topics.description: Introduction to NoSQL, types of NoSQL databases, CAP theorem, BASE properties, NoSQL vs relational databases, and use cases.
